Job DescriptionWho We Are:Night Market’s mission is to break down siloes between consulting, advertising and ecommerce to bring brands to the forefront of digital commerce, employing data and platform intelligence that provides greater insight into the consumer purchase journey and informs sustainable growth in an evolving ecommerce-first world. We aim to help advertisers gain a better understanding of the changing eCommerce landscape and ignite innovation around ways to integrate eCommerce strategies into their plans. Our core difference lies at the intersection of media and eCommerce optimization, providing data-driven insights that inform brands’ entire eCommerce strategy to drive desired business outcomes.At Night Market, we understand the value that different perspectives can bring to our clients and culture, so we strive for an environment where our employees feel welcomed, safe and empowered. We value YOU and believe that your authentic voice and unique perspective allows us to create a more rewarding culture, and experience, together.Our simple recipe for success? We hire talented people (thinkers, doers, dreamers, makers), challenge them and give them every opportunity to grow.Job SummaryWe are seeking a Data Science/Architect lead to work directly under and alongside the Head of Innovation and the President of Night Market. The VP, Data Science will architect an eCommerce media system which will discover machine learning insights to optimize retail related services including demand forecasting, pricing, merchandising, as well as media buying insights to improve adverting ROI within the walled gardens of Amazon, Walmart.com Facebook Marketplace, etc.This VP will have a proven track record of innovating and coming up with solutions to complex business problems and will pave the way for Night Market’s success from the ground up.This candidate should possess strong comprehension of eCommerce / retailer performance data, and prior experience at media agencies / programmatic media companies, during which the candidate was deeply entrenched with data strategy.We are looking for a special talent who has not only strong data skills, and executive-level communication skills, but also has technical prowess, and is able to make creative inferences to innovate audience and marketing strategies. Prior marketing analytics applied to audience briefs and media plans is required.The role includes architecting and managing performance media and commerce data and in building first to market IP intersecting media and commerce data sets, holistic understandings of audiences and their multichannel purchase journeys. The role will require significant strategy chops as we build our SaaS platform with the opportunity to author patented capabilities.We are leading the way in what we believe is the evolution of advertising, where we operate at the intersection retail media of and eCommerce data to link advertising to online revenue. We think about eCommerce marketing measurement, effectiveness and actionable insights; shopper propensity; audiences and customer journey analytics; CRM, digital analytics (website, mobile, app and social media); forecasting, financial analysis, user-level analysis, marketplaces/eRetailers performance; eCommerce shopper experiences.In addition to data strategy aspects, this role will involve cultivating and maintaining effective working relationships with a variety of parties, including the clients, internal NM stakeholders, 3rd-party vendors, and operational areas within the broader Horizon Media company. This is a high growth and visible role in a highly dynamic and fast-paced company.Role Will RequireVisioning and iterating a platform of smart models to help our brand clients make the most-informed decisions possible in allocating their media spend & eCommerce investmentThought leadership and product development leadership for the creation of new and existing statistical models, aimed at driving the maximum return, budget savings, and optimal business results for our clientsHands-on programming skills, ability to develop and edit financial models, and possess a creative mindsetUnderstanding of the media and commerce landscapes and the role that data and technology play withinRecent experience working within a media, retail media and/or a programmatic media environmentAnalytic engagements can include (but are not limited to) predictive models to determine media investment, predictive models to optimize media in flight, predictive models to improve product page conversions. In addition, MMM and attribution models, determining marketing effectiveness and ROI, customer journey analytics, CRM, digital analytics (website, mobile, app and social media), forecasting, financial analysis, user-level analysis, Marketplaces/eRetailers performance, eCommerce shopper experiences.What You’ll Do70% - Solution architecture, Analytics Applications & Predictive Insights Create analytics applications for real time, media investment, optimization, customer experience management and revenue optimizationArchitect and design data strategies to optimize for assembling fragmented retailer, 3rd party, media platforms, client and customer dataArchitect and design data strategies and GTM plans to drive revenue on our propriety media & commerce platformsSolve business problems through system development and buildingApply machine learning with high efficiency at scale to create and manage meaningful retail and media experiences through data, all in real time.Build processes for managing the exploration/exploitation trade-off in a multivariate machine learning online optimization application.Using machine learning technologies at scale, identifies and executes shortest path to highest commercial impact.20% - Client Involvement Crucial involvement in new business pitches and existing client communications, specifically focused and dedicated to media, eCommerce and eRetail verticals.Present models and methodology to clients and socialize results and learnings within the organization to drive business decisions.10% - Management, oversight, process implementation and best-practices Work with the engineering team to implement and build media and eCommerce systems and deliver best in class models and results.Build and lead a team of top data scientists ensuring the delivery of high impact data solutions.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs to ensure alignment on the development and delivery of scalable solutions.Preferred Skills & Experience10+ years’ experience leading the data science function, media and/or eCommerce experience is preferredPhD/MS in computer science, machine learning, statistics, applied mathematics, physics, or other scientific or computational disciplinesExperience with the application of data science and advanced analytics techniques across structured and unstructured dataExpertise in AI-driven automation for sustainable advantage.Deep understanding of data asset value and how to quantify unfulfilled potential.Expert in the application of petabyte scale consumer interaction and behavioral data for high performance accountable marketing and commerce.Experience in large-scale event-based data capture and management, coupled with predictive automation capabilities.Experience with the application of data science and advanced analytics techniques across structured and unstructured dataProven expertise applying data science techniques to solve business problems.Experience with Agile methodologiesSignificant experience working with data from “walled garde” digital ad platforms; e.g. Amazon, Facebook Marketplace, Walmart.comMarketing Mix Modeling (MMM) knowledge or experience is preferredExperience with Performance Media, eCommerce and data heavy marketingExperience with working in cloud-based environments like AWSExcellent verbal and written communications skillsPreferred
